page.title: 01Indian Queens and District.
page.content: There are really three villages in one that have joined together over the years along two main roads -the A30 and the A39.Indian Queens is on the A30,St.Columb Road is on the A39 and Fraddon is where the two roads join for a while before separating again. Indian Queens and St.Columb Road are joined by the A392 road which goes on to Newquay and the sea.If you take the B3279 road from Indian Queens towards St.Dennis you are going into the clay pit district where there are white mountains of waste from the clay pits. If you come to Indian Queens from Bodmin along the A30 you pass through moorland called the Goss Moors.As you enter Fraddon both the A30 and the A39 join,but at the end of Fraddon the roads separate again,the A30 going towards Redruth and the A39 going towards Truro.
